```{r}
library(tidyverse)

```

# Dataset

## Import

```{r, message=FALSE}
# Train data set----------------------------
tr_file <- 
  str_c(
    "../data/processed/",
    params$simulation,
    "sim"
  ) %>% 
  str_c(params$size, "train.csv", sep = "_")
# Test data set----------------------------
te_file <- 
  str_c(
    "../data/processed/",
    params$simulation,
    "sim"
  ) %>% 
  str_c(params$size, "test.csv", sep = "_")
# Import-----------------------------------
y_train <- read_csv(tr_file)
y_test <- read_csv(te_file)
num_test <- params$h
y_test <- 
  y_test %>% 
  slice(1:num_test)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
y_train %>% 
  mutate(train = TRUE) %>% 
  bind_rows(y_test %>% mutate(train = FALSE)) %>% 
  mutate(id = 1:n()) %>% 
  pivot_longer(-c(id, train), names_to = "asset", values_to = "value") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = id, y = value)) +
  # geom_path(aes(colour = train), show.legend = FALSE) +
  # facet_grid(asset ~ ., scales = "free_y") +
  annotate(
    geom = "rect",
    xmin = nrow(y_train),
    xmax = Inf,
    ymin = -Inf,
    ymax = Inf,
    alpha = .7,
    fill = "grey" # test set
  ) +
  geom_path(aes(colour = asset), show.legend = FALSE, alpha = .7) +
  # scale_colour_viridis_d() +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(
    x = element_blank(),
    y = element_blank()
  )
```

# Models

## VAR

```{r}
(var_lag <- params$var_lag)
```

```{r}
(include_mean <- params$include_mean)
```

```{r}
fit_var <- var_lm(y_train, var_lag, include_mean = include_mean)
pred_var <- predict(fit_var, num_test)
(mse_var <- mse(pred_var, y_test))
```

## VHAR

```{r}
fit_vhar <- vhar_lm(y_train, include_mean = include_mean)
pred_vhar <- predict(fit_vhar, num_test)
(mse_vhar <- mse(pred_vhar, y_test))
```

## BVAR

### Minnesota prior specification

- Shrinkage hyperparameter
- delta: White noise ($\delta_i = 0$) versus random walk ($\delta_i = 1$, Litterman)
- sigma: $\Sigma_e = diag(\sigma_1, \ldots, \sigma_m)$: use sd of each variable

```{r}
(bvar_spec <- set_bvar(
  sigma = apply(y_train, 2, sd),
  lambda = params$bvar_lam,
  delta = rep(params$bvar_del, ncol(y_train)),
  eps = 1e-04
))
```

### fit

```{r}
(bvar_lag <- params$bvar_lag)
```

```{r}
fit_bvar <- bvar_minnesota(y_train, bvar_lag, bayes_spec = bvar_spec, include_mean = include_mean)
pred_bvar <- predict(fit_bvar, num_test)
(mse_bvar <- mse(pred_bvar, y_test))
```

## BVHAR

### VAR-type BVHAR

```{r}
(bvhar_spec_v1 <- set_bvhar(
  sigma = apply(y_train, 2, sd),
  lambda = params$bvhar_lam,
  delta = rep(params$bvhar_del, ncol(y_train)),
  eps = 1e-04
))
```

```{r}
fit_bvhar_v1 <- bvhar_minnesota(y_train, bayes_spec = bvhar_spec_v1, include_mean = include_mean)
pred_bvhar_v1 <- predict(fit_bvhar_v1, num_test)
(mse_bvhar_v1 <- mse(pred_bvhar_v1, y_test))
```

### HAR-type BVHAR

$\delta_i$ for every daily, weekly, monthly matrix

```{r}
(bvhar_spec_v2 <- set_weight_bvhar(
  sigma = apply(y_train, 2, sd),
  lambda = params$bvhar_lam,
  eps = 1e-04,
  daily = rep(params$daily_del, ncol(y_train)),
  weekly = rep(params$weekly_del, ncol(y_train)),
  monthly = rep(params$monthly_del, ncol(y_train))
))
```


### HAR-type BVHAR

```{r}
fit_bvhar_v2 <- bvhar_minnesota(y_train, bayes_spec = bvhar_spec_v2, include_mean = include_mean)
pred_bvhar_v2 <- predict(fit_bvhar_v2, num_test)
(mse_bvhar_v2 <- mse(pred_bvhar_v2, y_test))
```

## Compare

### Plot

```{r}
autoplot(pred_var, x_cut = plot_cut, ci_alpha = .6, type = "wrap") +
  autolayer(pred_vhar, ci_alpha = .5) +
  autolayer(pred_bvar, ci_alpha = .4) +
  autolayer(pred_bvhar_v1, ci_alpha = .3) +
  autolayer(pred_bvhar_v2, ci_alpha = .2) +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom") +
  scale_colour_viridis_d() +
  scale_fill_viridis_d()
```

### Mean of mse

Every variable:

```{r}
list(
  VAR = pred_var,
  VHAR = pred_vhar,
  BVAR = pred_bvar,
  BVHAR1 = pred_bvhar_v1,
  BVHAR2 = pred_bvhar_v2
) %>% 
  lapply(function(PRED) mse(PRED, y = y_test) %>% mean()) %>% 
  unlist() %>% 
  sort()
```

Average over *key variables* (in small set), i.e. first 5 ones:

```{r}
list(
  VAR = pred_var,
  VHAR = pred_vhar,
  BVAR = pred_bvar,
  BVHAR1 = pred_bvhar_v1,
  BVHAR2 = pred_bvhar_v2
) %>% 
  lapply(function(PRED) mse(PRED, y = y_test)[1:5] %>% mean()) %>% 
  unlist() %>% 
  sort()
```

### Each variable

```{r}
list(
  pred_var,
  pred_vhar,
  pred_bvar,
  pred_bvhar_v1,
  pred_bvhar_v2
) %>% 
  plot_loss(y = y_test) +
  # scale_y_log10() +
  theme_minimal()
```
